class.name: CommitStatusPublisher
class.description: A [build feature](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/?Commit+Status+Publisher) publishing status to external system.

param.name: vcsRootId
param.description: Id of the VCS root for which commits a status should be published. Set to an empty string to publish status for all VCS roots attached to a build configuration.

param.name: publisherId
param.description: The type of the VCS provider to which the build status should be published.

param.name: build_custom_name
param.description: Specifies the name of the build displayed in the status message posted to the Bitbucket Cloud.

param.name: bitbucketUsername
param.description: A username for the Bitbucket Cloud connection.

param.name: secure:bitbucketPassword
param.description: A password for the Bitbucket Cloud connection.

param.name: authType
param.description: Use username / password credentials.

param.name: bitbucketUsername
param.description: A username for the Bitbucket Cloud connection.

param.name: secure:bitbucketPassword
param.description: A password for the Bitbucket Cloud connection.

option.name: storedToken
option.description: Use token credentials stored in TeamCity.

param.name: tokenId
param.description: The internal ID of the token that the VCS connection should use.

option.name: bitbucketServer
option.description: Publish build statuses to Bitbucket Server / Data Center.

param.name: build_custom_name
param.description: Specifies the name of the build displayed in the status message posted to the Bitbucket Server / Data Center

param.name: stashBaseUrl
param.description: Bitbucket Server URL

param.name: stashUsername
param.description: A username for the Bitbucket Server / Data Center connection.

param.name: secure:stashPassword
param.description: A password for the Bitbucket Server / Data Center connection.

param.name: stashUsername
param.description: A username for the Bitbucket Server / Data Center connection.

param.name: secure:stashPassword
param.description: A password for the Bitbucket Server / Data Center connection.

option.name: storedToken
option.description: Use token credentials stored in TeamCity.

param.name: tokenId
param.description: The internal ID of the token that the VCS connection should use.

option.name: gerrit
option.description: Publish status to Gerrit Code Review.

param.name: gerritServer
param.description: Gerrit server in the format: {server}[:{port}]

param.name: gerritProject
param.description: Gerrit project name

param.name: label
param.description: A custom Gerrit label. Defaults to "Verified" if not set.

param.name: failureVote
param.description: A failed build vote, e.g. "-1".

param.name: successVote
param.description: A successful build vote, e.g. "+1".

param.name: gerritUsername
param.description: A username for the Gerrit connection.

param.name: teamcitySshKey
param.description: Name of the [uploaded key](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/?SSH+Keys+Management) to use for Gerrit connection.

param.name: build_custom_name
param.description: Specifies the name of the build displayed in the status message posted to the GitHub.

param.name: github_host
param.description: GitHub server URL. Use "https://api.github.com" for projects hosted at github.com. For GitHub enterprise use the URL in the following format: http{s}://{host}:{port}/api/v3.

param.name: github_authentication_type
param.description: The authentication type.

param.name: secure:github_access_token
param.description: The personal token to use.

param.name: github_username
param.description: A username for the GitHub connection.

param.name: secure:github_password
param.description: A password for the GitHub connection.

param.name: tokenId
param.description: The internal ID of a token in TeamCity token storage.

param.name: build_custom_name
param.description: Specifies the name of the build displayed in the status message posted to the GitLab.

param.name: gitlabApiUrl
param.description: GitLab URL in the format http[s]://{hostname}[:port]/api/v4. If unspecified, the URL will be composed based on the VCS root fetch URL.

param.name: secure:gitlabAccessToken
param.description: Access token to use for GitLab connection. Can be found at /profile/account in GitLab.

param.name: secure:gitlabAccessToken
param.description: The access token that the GitLab connection should use. Can be found at /profile/account in GitLab.

param.name: tokenId
param.description: The internal ID of a token in TeamCity token storage.

param.name: upsourceServerUrl
param.description: The Upsource server URL.

param.name: upsourceProjectId
param.description: The Upsource project ID.

param.name: upsourceUsername
param.description: A username for the Upsource connection.

param.name: secure:upsourcePassword
param.description: A password for the Upsource connection.

option.name: azureDevOps
option.description: Publish build statuses to Azure DevOps / TFS.

param.name: build_custom_name
param.description: Specifies the name of the build displayed in the status message posted to the Azure DevOps.

param.name: tfsServerUrl
param.description: Azure DevOps / TFS Server URL.

param.name: tfsAuthType
param.description: The authentication type.

param.name: secure:accessToken
param.description: A Personal Access Token value.

option.name: storedToken
option.description: Use token credentials stored in TeamCity.

param.name: tokenId
param.description: The internal ID of the token that the VCS connection should use.

param.name: publish.pull.requests
param.description: Enables publishing build status for pull requests.

option.name: tfs
option.description: Publish build status to Azure DevOps / TFS.

param.name: tfsServerUrl
param.description: Azure DevOps / TFS Server URL.

param.name: tfsAuthType
param.description: The authentication type.

param.name: secure:accessToken
param.description: A Personal Access Token value.

param.name: publish.pull.requests
param.description: Enables publishing build status for pull requests.

option.name: space
option.description: Publish build statuses to JetBrains Space.

param.name: spaceCredentialsType
param.description: The authentication type.

param.name: spaceConnectionId
param.description: The project feature ID of a JetBrains Space connection.

param.name: spaceProjectKey
param.description: The JetBrains Space Project Key.

param.name: spaceCommitStatusPublisherDisplayName
param.description: The display name.

option.name: swarm
option.description: Publish build statuses to Perforce P4 Code Review (Helix Swarm).

param.name: swarmUrl
param.description: The URL of the Peforce P4 Code Review (Helix Swarm) server.

param.name: swarmUser
param.description: The username to access the server.

param.name: secure:swarmPassword
param.description: The token or password to access the Perforce P4 Code Review (Helix Swarm) server.

param.name: createSwarmTest
param.description: If set, TeamCity will create a test run on the P4 Code Review (Helix Swarm) server and update its status according to the build status in TeamCity.

param.name: commentOnEvents
param.description: If enabled, TeamCity will add comments to a related review when a build fails or finishes successfully. This defaults to true.

example.description: Publishes build statuses to GitHub.com / GitHub Enterprise. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.
Publishes build statuses to GitHub.com / GitHub Enterprise. Uses the credentials of the VCS root.
Publishes build statuses to GitHub.com / GitHub Enterprise. Uses a GitHub App installation token stored in TeamCity.
Publishes build statuses to GitHub.com / GitHub Enterprise. Sets the buildName value as a build name displayed in the status message posted to the VCS.

Publishes build statuses to GitLab.com / GitLab CE/EE. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.

Publishes build statuses to GitLab.com / GitLab CE/EE. Instead of personal token authentication a refreshable access token stored in TeamCity is used. Sets the buildName value as build name displayed in the status message posted to the VCS.

Publishes build statuses to Bitbucket Cloud. The password must be Bitbucket App password generated by user. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.

Publishes build statuses to Bitbucket Cloud. Instead of password authentication an access token stored in TeamCity is used. Sets the buildName value as build name displayed in the status message posted to the VCS.

Publishes build statuses to Bitbucket Server / Data Center. The password can be either user's password (not recommended) or Bitbucket HTTP access token generated by user. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.

Publishes build statuses to Bitbucket Server / Data Center. Instead of password authentication an access token stored in TeamCity is used. Sets the buildName value as build name displayed in the status message posted to the VCS.

Publishes build statuses to Azure DevOps. For now only personal access token authentication type is supported. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.

Publishes build statuses to Azure DevOps. Instead of password authentication an access token stored in TeamCity is used. Sets the buildName value as build name displayed in the status message posted to the VCS.

Enables publishing build statuses to Perforce P4 Code Review (Helix Swarm). For now only personal access token authentication type is supported. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.
Enables voting in Gerrit based on build statuses.

Enables publishing build statuses to JetBrains Upsource. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.
